Class GameState

java.lang.Object
AI.mcts.HexGame.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
Encapsulates the state of a Hex game for use within the MCTS simulation.

This class wraps the core Board object and tracks the current player, winner status, and terminal state. It provides methods for cloning states and applying moves during tree traversal and rollouts.

  • Method Details

    • isTerminal

      public boolean isTerminal()
      Checks if the game has ended in this state. * @return true if a winner has been determined

    • getWinnerId

      public int getWinnerId()
      Returns the ID of the winning player. * @return 0 if no winner, 1 for RED, 2 for BLACK

    • getToMove

      public Player getToMove()
      Returns the player whose turn it is to move in this state. * @return the Player enum

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Retrieves the underlying board object. * @return the Board

    • getLegalMoves

      public List<Move> getLegalMoves()
      Generates a list of all legal moves available from this state. * @return a list of Move objects representing empty cells

    • doMove

      public void doMove(Move move)
      Applies the specified move to the state.

      Updates the board, switches the active player, and checks for a terminal condition. * @param move the move to execute

    • copy

      public GameState copy()
      Creates a deep copy of this game state.

      Uses efficient copying mechanisms for the board to support rapid MCTS simulations. * @return a new GameState instance identical to the current one

    • recomputeTerminal

      private void recomputeTerminal()
      Recomputes the terminal status and winner based on the current board.

      Called after moves to update the game state accordingly.

    • toColor

      private Color toColor(Player p)
      Converts a Player enum to the corresponding Color.
      Parameters:
      p - the player
      Returns:
      the corresponding Color

    • estimateAfterMove

      public int estimateAfterMove(Move m)
      Estimates the strategic value of the board for the current player after making a specific move.

      This is often used by heuristics to score moves based on how much they reduce the shortest path to victory. * @param m the move to evaluate

      Returns:
      the estimated shortest path distance after the move

    • estimateShortestPathForCurrentPlayer

      public int estimateShortestPathForCurrentPlayer()
      Calculates the shortest path distance for the player whose turn it is. * @return the length of the shortest path

    • estimateShortestPathForPlayer

      public int estimateShortestPathForPlayer(Player p)
      Calculates the shortest path distance for the specified player. * @param p the player whose path to evaluate
      Returns:
      the length of the shortest path
